title.narrative: DEMAND GENERATION FOR HEALTHY OUTCOMES

description.narrative: By 2025, parents, caregivers, children and pregnant women benefit from strengthened, evidence-informed communication approaches to improve their health care practices., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care (Covid), Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, more neonates, infants and children survive and thrive, and fewer women die during pregnancy and childbirth.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, parents, caregivers, children and pregnant women benefit from strengthened, evidence-informed communication approaches toimprove their health care practices.

description.narrative: UNICEF played a vital role in COVID-19 information dissemination, advocacy, and demand generation for preventive behaviors and vaccinations. Communication for Development interventions contributed to promoting routine and polio vaccinations. As a notable progress, the drop-out rate between DPT 1 and DPT 3 decreased from 17% in 2020 to 11.1% in 2021. Three social and behavior change communication plans (Puntland, Somaliland and Federal Member States) for oral polio vaccine type 2 were ;developed to accelerate efforts for polio elimination in Somalia. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:17/12/2021
